summary: Quick introductions and role confirmations: client greeted the team; PM (Sarah) asked what to work on; Architect (Mike), Developer (Alex), and QA (Jordan) stated areas they can support and offered availability.

actions.task: Clarify priorities and specify which work or features the team should start on
Coordinate with the client to define next work items, set priorities, and assign tasks to the team
Prepare to review architecture, interfaces, trade-offs, and non-functional requirements once specific areas are requested
Be ready to take on development tasks and perform code reviews once tasks are assigned
Perform QA testing when features or tickets are ready and the team notifies QA

risks.risk: No specific tasks, priorities, or acceptance criteria were defined during the meeting, which may cause delays or misaligned work.
risks.mitigation: PM (Sarah) should gather requirements and priorities from the client, create clear backlog items with acceptance criteria, assign owners and due dates, and notify the team.
